item.title: Updating the Password of a Storage Backend Using oceanctl
item.description: Example of Updating a Backend Run the following command to obtain the help information about updating a storage backend. oceanctl update backend -h The following is an example of the command output. Update a backend for Ocean Storage in Kubernetes Usage: oceanctl update backend <name> [flags] Examples: # Update backend account information in default(huawei-csi) namespace oceanctl update backend <name> --password # Update backend account information in specified namespace oceanctl update backend <name> -n namespace --password Flags: -h, --help help for backend -n, --namespace string namespace of resources --password Update account password Run the following command to update a storage backend.

item.title: Manually Updating a Storage Backend
item.description: PVC provisioning must be based on a configured storage backend. Therefore, if a PVC has been provisioned on a storage backend, do not change the storage backend. The name uniquely identifies a storage backend. The name of a storage backend with a PVC provisioned cannot be changed. After a storage backend is modified, the new configuration applies only to volumes to be provisioned. Do not perform volume management operations during the modification of a storage backend.
